title: South Africa's credit demand growth slows to 6.19% y/y in September
text:
South Africa's credit demand growth slows to 6.19% y/y in September

Economic Indicators 1 hour ago (Oct 29, 2019 08:12)

JOHANNESBURG, Oct 29 (Reuters) - Growth in private sector credit in South Africa slowed to 6.19% year-on-year in September from 6.86% in the previous month, central bank data showed on Tuesday. Expansion in the broadly defined M3 measure of money supply also slowed, to 6.11% in September from 7.45% in August.

South Africa's credit demand growth slows to 6.19% y/y in September
